author: A_Brickset_user
title: Nice Looking Car
review: This set goes together with city nicely. The car is very "flexible" since the roof could be removed easily to make a converdable. Unlike some newer sets this car actually has doors. Also the minifigure looks cool. Overall good set to own. 5/5

author: hustla187
title: excellent town set
review: This hot rod right here is an excellent example of Lego design. It is very, very detailed down to every piece. The car comes with a removable top and the minifig looks like he loves his car. A must own for any town collection.

author: Pickwick
title: Une des plus belles voitures LEGO
review:
Elle a du style, un look vraiment très réussi : moteur apparent, petit pare-brise, capote avec toit ouvrant, grosses roues à l'arrière.

Sympathique à monter, elle a un charme rétro inimitable.

Même le propriétaire avec son blouson de cuir reste dans le ton de cette boîte.

Avec la voiture 6646, elles sont indispensable dans toute ville Lego !

Pour voir d'autres photos, cliquer ici !

author: szerman
title: One of my favourite small cars
review: This is my third Lego set. It has very cool looks like a muscle car, big motor, bigger wheelers in his backside than in front, the doors and nice roof with a window. The minifig has co cool black jacket :) I got it in Christmas in 1996, but today I don't have the red doors :( I'm sorry for my poor English :)

author: sf1378
title: VRRRR-OOOOOOOMMMMMMM!
review:
Nice little Roadster. Got mine today via ebay. Not much else that others have said but I do find the roof doesn't sit well when the figures inside the car-the bricks behind him slightly raise off the 1 x 4 brick behind his back...bit disappointed by that but thats the only negative gripe.

Perhaps Lego should have done the car in yellow and red instead? Recommend it though to any AFOL!

author: sunriva
title: Great fun little car for any Lego City
review: Great little car which worked well in any town layout. Very creative use of bricks allowed many customisation options to make your own rod. I enjoyed using the car more as a convertible and could never figure out the perfect cylinder angle for the variable engine blocks :)

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Town (Vehicles) - Rebel Roadster Review
review:
This is a good little set to have and it's fun to play with as well.

Box/Instructions

The instruction has only 2 pages and there're no mistakes in it.

Parts

This set has 57 pieces and it was 4.50 USD when it was on sale. The price per piece ratio was 9 cents per piece which is a really good value for this little model.

Minifigures

This set only has one minifig. The driver has a black suit and a white cap.

The build

The build was very nice and easy and we also don't need to worry about stickers.

The completed model

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/6538-1.jpg[/img]


This set may doesn't do much but it's still very fun to maneuver it. The doors can be opened on each side and on the front you can see a very nice looking engine which you can adjust as well. The top can be opened very easily as well. I really like the design of this car and I think it's a good addition to any LEGO city for sure.

Summary

All in all this set is an great set and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de



Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion 1

Stopmotion 2

Stopmotion 3

Stopmotion 4

Review

author: CamberbrickGreen
title: Red Hot Hot Rod
review:
Welcome back to Lego Town. Here with the ongoing use of bow bricks, we see vehicles start to receive some interesting design innovations.

Minifigures:

[··][··][··][··]

I love these old 'smart suits' when they have not cropped up for a while, with the white cap he appears to be dressed to drive.

V8 Growl
The build is a short but sweet activity seeing as the black hood and its cool downward tilt is on to a car body that is not the largest ever. This matters not as the meaty engine pokes out of the bonnet and there is a tiny little styling that has been shown on the front with a rad knob or similar. The front tiny windscreen is novel and effective. The whole tilt of big wheels to small makes you wonder why it had not been done more before for a fuller subtheme of hot rods, convertibles and drag racing,  The larger set is good for getting the value of 3 cars but this remains a worthy design and excellent addition to the traffic of vehicles a Town inevitably gets. Too many cars can be a bad thing but little gems like this make jamming up the road plates an enjoyable experience. Broom!

author: maxtimebuster
title: Leather Freak
review:
In Germany the set called  "Leather Freak", I don't know whether this is the best name for a toy.

Pros

- nice minifig
- well designed car
- good parts

Cons


Another good civil car set with one minifig, truly a legend. Shouldn't be missed in any collection. This freak still running wild today.
